@graph.name: Nut Free Vegan Nacho Cheese Slices. Gluten-free Recipe - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: This Nut Free Vegan Nacho Cheese is simple, makes wonderful slices and does not use any agar to set. Chickpea Cheese! Find the secret ingredient.

itemListElement.name: Nut Free Vegan Nacho Cheese Slices. Gluten-free Recipe

@graph.name: Nut Free Vegan Nacho Cheese Slices. Gluten-free Recipe
@graph.description: This Nut Free Vegan Nacho Cheese is simple, makes wonderful slices and does not use any agar to set. Find the secret ingredient and make some today
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp each of garlic powder, onion powder, mustard powder
2 Tbsp roasted red pepper  (or roasted pimento pepper)
1/2 to 1  chipotle pepper in adobo sauce (use 1/2 tsp chipotle powder if you cannot find gf canned peppers)

recipeInstructions.text: Put everything in a blender and blend until fully combined. Use 3/4 cup water for shredd-able block, 1 cup water for slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Put everything in a blender and blend until fully combined. Use 3/4 cup water for shredd-able block, 1 cup water for slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Add to thick bottom pan, and heat at medium-low heat. Keep stirring frequently.
recipeInstructions.name: Add to thick bottom pan, and heat at medium-low heat. Keep stirring frequently.

recipeInstructions.text: The mixture will start to thicken and get lumpy, then smooth out. The mixture will eventually become custard-like and evenly thick. After the mixture has become a thick even custard, Cook for another 2 -3 minutes to cook the chickpea flour. Stir continuously. You can carefully taste at this point and add salt, spice and tang if needed. * Cook a bit longer if not sure. You want to cook the chickpea flour really well, else it can taste raw (bitter and bad) in the slices later.
recipeInstructions.name: The mixture will start to thicken and get lumpy, then smooth out. The mixture will eventually become custard-like and evenly thick. After the mixture has become a thick even custard, Cook for another 2 -3 minutes to cook the chickpea flour. Stir continuously. You can carefully taste at this point and add salt, spice and tang if needed. * Cook a bit longer if not sure. You want to cook the chickpea flour really well, else it can taste raw (bitter and bad) in the slices later.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped jalapeno and pepper flakes if using and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped jalapeno and pepper flakes if using and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the hot mixture to a greased brownie pan or parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the hot mixture to a greased brownie pan or parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray oil on top. Place another parchment on top and press to a thin square. or use rolling pin.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray oil on top. Place another parchment on top and press to a thin square. or use rolling pin.

recipeInstructions.text: Chill for an hour. Slice and use or store refrigerated for upto 5 days.
recipeInstructions.name: Chill for an hour. Slice and use or store refrigerated for upto 5 days.

recipeInstructions.text: Or transfer the mixture to a greased deep small container. Chill for an hour or more before shredding.
recipeInstructions.name: Or transfer the mixture to a greased deep small container. Chill for an hour or more before shredding.

recipeInstructions.text: * You can make nacho cheese sauce with the recipe as well. Use a 1/4 cup chickpea flour with 1 cup of water or non dairy milk. Cook to thicken (about 5 to 6 minutes so chickpea flour gets cooked through, taste and adjust. Use to top nachos!
recipeInstructions.name: * You can make nacho cheese sauce with the recipe as well. Use a 1/4 cup chickpea flour with 1 cup of water or non dairy milk. Cook to thicken (about 5 to 6 minutes so chickpea flour gets cooked through, taste and adjust. Use to top nachos!
